name: ITP - 119 - Stormwater Treatment Device
template name: ITP - 119 - Stormwater Treatment Device Rev B

name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide topographic survey reports and electronic survey models (in a dxf or dwg format) to enable the Engineer to verify quantities.
Frequency - Prior to works and Post works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall test representative samples of the site-won material to be used as Bulk Fill, the results are to be sent to the Engineer for approval.
Verifying Document - MDD, OMC, Shear Vane, PSD
Frequency - At least 2 days prior to placement and compaction.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage pipes used in subsoil drainage shall be smooth bore perforated corrugated 160mm diameter complying with NZTA F5 unless otherwise stated on the drawings. Pipes shall not have a geofabric filter sock unless requested by the Engineer.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When placing geotextile wrapped drainage aggregate, the drainage material shall be in accordance with TNZ F/6 including gradings (40/20 aggregate). Be open course grade clean durable aggregate, Have a crushing resistance of no less than 100kN when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991 Test 3.11 Meet the following gradings when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991, Test 3.8.1:
○ App B - HAM2018-0136AJ Rev. 1 Geotechnical Works Specification:
Table 2: Filter Material Gradings (Geotextile Wrapped Aggregate)

Frequency - Material Tests every 1000m³ or change of source. Visual inspection every load, verifying document photos of material onsite, if visual appearance changes, additional testing will be required.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Any filter cloth surround specified on the drawings shall meet the requirements of Transit Specification TNZ/F7, Filtration Class 2 and Strength Class B unless otherwise specified on the drawings.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be meet or exceed the test values of Bentosure NW4000.
Frequency - Atleast 2 days prior to placement
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NZTA F/07 Strength Class C & Filter Class 1 geotextile is to be used to wrap 20/40 drainage aggregate. Confirm before placement
Verifying Document - Technical Datasheet Delivery Dockets or photos

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage aggregate should be taken to the underside of the next layer. Drainage Aggregate should be deep washed and in accordance with TNZ F/6 including gradings (40/20 aggregate). Open course grade clean durable aggregate, Have a crushing resistance of no less than 100kN when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991 Test 3.11 Meet the following gradings when tested in accordance with NZS 4407:1991, Test 3.8.1:
○ App B - HAM2018-0136AJ Rev. 1 Geotechnical Works Specification:
Table 2: Filter Material Gradings (Geotextile Wrapped Aggregate)

Frequency - Material Tests every 1000m³ or change of source. Visual inspection every load, verifying document photos of material onsite, if visual appearance changes, additional testing will be required.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Drainage pipes used in subsoil drainage shall be smooth bore perforated corrugated 110 mm diameter Class 200 complying with NZTA F5 unless otherwise stated on the drawings. Pipes shall not have a geofabric filter sock unless requested by the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of pipes onsite with tag showing class
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filter/ Planting Media must follow the specification as per RITS 4.2.19. Seen below.
○ Total Phosphorus: Leachate testing required if > 100 mg kg-^1
○ Media sources: From a clean source (no waste Products)
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of mix
○ Mat (Coir Mat). Biodegradable mulching fabric 450 gsm
Standard / Specification - DWG 2195 REV1. Schedule SP2 4.3.7
Verifying Document - Verifying document to be copy of delivery dockets, photos of mat onsite
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All surface objects including fences, gates, debris, wood, dumped rubbish, concrete and other protruding obstructions shall be cleared and disposed of
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Vegetation, Tree stumps, shrubs, plants, logs, including any roots greater than 25mm in diameter shall be cleared and disposed of
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide all pumping plant and drainage systems required to ensure excavations are always free from water.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall obtain written approval from the Engineer prior to cutting any material to waste. To include evidence and extents of cut to waste. Topography survey data of all material to leave site, photographs of material and any material test reports.
Frequency - Prior to cut to waste

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The foundation on which filling is to be placed must be observed by the Engineer following clearing and prior to the placement of any filling to confirm the strength of the underlying soils is sufficient.
Frequency - Prior to the placement of any filling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Unsuitable ground shall be defined as any pre-existing uncertified filling or natural silts/clays having an undrained shear strength of less than 70kPa or natural sands having less than 3 blows per 100mm penetration when tested with a Scala penetrometer. The contractor shall obtain instruction from Engineer around extent and depth of undercut.
Verifying Document - Shear Vane / Scala penetrometer
Frequency - Prior to the placement of any filling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Preparation of the firm to stiff / medium dense subgrade beneath the proposed fill areas should comprise stripping of all vegetation, topsoil, any pre-existing fill materials or weak alluvium followed by benching of the exposed subgrade where natural slopes beneath the fill exceed gradients of nominally 1:5 (vertical to horizontal).
Frequency - Prior to placement and compaction of fill
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Bulk fill shall be tested by DT at 300mm probe depth
○ 95% MDD. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number, each test lift not to exceed 500mm thick.
Frequency - 1 set / 500m3 (1 set to include 1 x 0.5m deep Scala and 1 x DT within a 3m radius)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Bulk fill shall be tested by Scala Penetrometer every 500m3 to:
○ 4 blows per 100mm. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number, each test lift not to exceed 500mm thick.
Frequency - 1 set / 500m3 (1 set to include 1 x 0.5m deep Scala and 1 x NDM within a 3m radius)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Bulk fill shall be tested for Vane Shear Strength to:

○ Minimum average 120kPa over 10 tests, minimum single value 110kPa. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number, each test lift not to exceed 500mm thick. NDM direct transmission with probe depth of 300mm.
Frequency - 1 set / 500m3 (1 set to include 5 x shear vanes and 1 x air voids within a 3m radius)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Bulk fill shall be tested for Air Voids to:

○ Maximum average 10% over 10 tests, maximum single value 12%. Survey shot at each test location, point ID to be agreed upon by contractor/sub-contractor to match test number, each test lift not to exceed 500mm thick. NDM direct transmission with probe depth of 300mm.
Frequency - 1 set / 500m3 (1 set to include 5 x shear vanes and 1 x air voids within a 3m radius)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Shaped surface (pre topsoil) in forebays meets design RLs. Sloped areas must conform to the desiged grades.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil thickness must meet minimum requirements. Planted areas must have a minimum topsoil thickness of 300mm. Non planted areas must have a minimum thickness of 100mm.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Top soil meets finished level RL's in forebays. Sloped Areas must conform to the desiged grade.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Check set-out prior to excavation of Rain Garden.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Excavations shall be completed in such manner that it is true to the drawings will allow novacoil to be laid true to the depths, grades and lines.
Frequency - Prior to laying filter cloth
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL liner overlaps must welded. Installation, anchoring and pipe penetrations according to manufacterers spec. Extent of GCL liner must conform with the design.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be repaired as per manufacture's guidelnes (Bentofix PVB5100c). GCL becomes damaged, torn or punctured during installation, the affected area should be repaired. For damaged areas, a separate piece of GCL shall be used and extend past the comprimised section by 500mm in every direction. Bentonite shall be used to connect the seperate GCL to the main liner.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - GCL to be installed as per manufacturers guide and true to the drawings.The inspection should include overlaps, alignments, penetrations, connections, detections of any defects, including installation damage. Detected falsely installed areas shall be marked, repaired and the repairs shall be inspected and approved engineer.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All geotextiles shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Before placement of any geotextile should form an Engineers inspection hold point
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Bedding thickness shall be no less than 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Joining the pipe shall be done using a purpose made pullout resistant coupling in accordance with manufacturers recommendations
Verifying Document - Copy of delivery dockets, photos of joins onsite with tag showing class
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Grade of subsoils must be falling in the correct direction based on the IFC Drawings and at the correct grade (Minimum grade of 0.5%) unless stated otherwise.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pipe to have 100mm of drainage aggregate as top cover for pipe.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Filter media to be placed at a constant average thickness of 500mm, refer to drawing for detail. Filter media should be free of peaks and troughs.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mat shall be placed in accordance with the Manufacturer’s instructions and installed as specified on the drawings. A minimum overlap of 500mm is required between sheets.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Scour protection shall be installed as per drawings around let downs, scruffy dome and the flush point end.
Verifying Document - Site Photos/ Survey Data

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Observation of the cloth wrap should form an inspection hold point prior to backfilling over the drain. TNZ F/6, PWRBSS Geotechnical Specification - The geotextile shall be placed in the tench so as to conform loosely to the shape of the trench. Cloth must fully encapsulate the aggregate. Geotextile longitudinal overlap to be minimum 300 mm (as indicated on drawing 3051 and required by NZTA F/6). Additional sheets to overlap by minimum 500 mm and anchored with securing pins (F/6 requirement). Verifying document, photos of trench prior to backfill, every line.
Frequency - Photos of trench prior to backfill

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Backfilling of all trenches should be to the fill standard of the material previously trenched through. Drainage aggregate to be placed in layers of 150mm or less. Only light compaction such as tamping with the back of an excavator bucket is to be applied.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of earthworks the Contractor shall flush the subsoil drainage system. This must be witnessed by the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Trenches shall be cut in such manner as will ensure that the geotextile wrapped aggregate subsoil drains, and pipes if included, will be laid true to the depths, grades and lines shown on the drawings
Frequency - Prior to laying filter cloth
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Bedding thickness shall be no less than 100mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - TNZ F/5 - Joining the pipe shall be done using a purpose made pullout resistant coupling in accordance with manufacturers recommendations
Verifying Document - Copy of delivery dockets, photos of pipes onsite with tag showing class
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting including, initial subgrade level, all undercuts, all test location points, and final level
Frequency - As-builts taken every 10m prior to backfill

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen.To show all subsoils, including temporary subsoils that become part of the permanent works, to show all outlet locations
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum subgrade, undercuts, all service ducting/pipe lines immediately before backfill, warning tape / mag slabs immediately before backfill.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
